item.title: Create a Rule Group
item.description:
This section introduces how to create an alert rule group.

The monitoring and alerting functions of KubeSphere are implemented based on Prometheus. Each rule group can contain multiple alert rules. You can create alert rules using the rule templates provided by the system or manually enter PromQL expressions to create alert rules. For more information, see the Prometheus Documentation.

Prerequisites

  • The WhizardTelemetry Alerting extension must be installed and enabled on the KubeSphere platform.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Management permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

item.title: View Rule Group List
item.description:
This section introduces how to view the alert rule group list.

Prerequisites

  • The WhizardTelemetry Alerting extension must be installed and enabled on the KubeSphere platform.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Viewing permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Rule Group Viewing permission and enter your cluster or project.

  2. Click Monitoring & Alerting > Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the Rule Groups page, click Custom Rule Groups or Built-in Rule Groups to open the rule group list.

    • The rule group list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: View Rule Group Details
item.description:
This section introduces how to view the details of an alert rule group.

Prerequisites

  • The WhizardTelemetry Alerting extension must be installed and enabled on the KubeSphere platform.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Viewing permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Rule Group Viewing permission and enter your cluster or project.

  2. Click Monitoring & Alerting > Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the Rule Groups page, click Custom Rule Groups or Built-in Rule Groups, then click the name of a rule group in the list to open its details page.

  4. View the resource attributes of the rule group in the Attributes area on the left side of the details page.

    Parameter Description

    Rule Group Status

item.title: Edit Rule Group Information
item.description:
This section introduces how to edit the information of an alert rule group.

You can edit the alias, check interval, and description of the alert rule group. KubeSphere does not support editing the name of a rule group.

Prerequisites

  • The WhizardTelemetry Alerting extension must be installed and enabled on the KubeSphere platform.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Management permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

item.title: Edit Alert Rules
item.description:
This section describes how to edit alert rules in a rule group.

Note

KubeSphere only supports editing custom rule groups, not built-in rule groups.

Prerequisites

  • WhizardTelemetry Alerting should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Management permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

item.title: Disable and Enable Rule Groups
item.description:
This section describes how to enable and disable alerting rule groups. After a rule group is disabled, the system will no longer generate alerts based on the rule group.

Prerequisites

  • WhizardTelemetry Alerting should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Management permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

Disable and Enable a Single Rule Group

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Rule Group Management permission and enter your cluster or project.

  2. Click Monitoring Alerting > Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the Rule Groups page, click Custom Rule Groups or Built-in Rule Groups to open the rule group list.

  4. Click on the right side of the rule group you need to disable, and then select Disable from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Disable Rule Group dialog, enter the name of the rule group, and then click OK.

  6. Click on the right side of the disabled rule group, and then select Enable from the dropdown list to enable the rule group.

item.title: Delete Rule Groups
item.description:
This section describes how to delete alert rule groups.

Note

KubeSphere only supports deleting custom rule groups, not built-in rule groups.
Warning

Rule groups cannot be recovered after deletion, so please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • WhizardTelemetry Alerting should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a cluster or a project and have the Rule Group Management permission within the cluster or the project. For more information, refer to "Cluster Roles" and "Project Roles".

item.title: Reset Built-in Rule Groups
item.description:
This section describes how to reset built-in rule groups.

Note

  • KubeSphere only supports resetting built-in rule groups, not custom rule groups.

  • There are no built-in rule groups in projects.
Warning

Rule groups cannot be recovered after resetting, so please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • WhizardTelemetry Alerting should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a cluster and have the Rule Group Management permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".
